titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New York University Archives Collection of Student Theses MC.83

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-03 11:42:44 -0400.

change.item: Updated by Megan Oâ€™Shea for compliance with DACS and ACM Required Elements for Archival Description

did.unittitle: New York University Archives Collection of Student Theses
did.abstract: The New York University Archives Collection of Student Theses consists of five theses written by New York University students in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. The collection was created by the New York University Archives in 2019.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Decisions regarding arrangement, description, and physical interventions for this collection prior to 2020 are unknown. In 2020 the collection level description was updated for compliance with DACS and ACM Required Elements for Archival Description.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The New York University Archives Collection of Student Theses was created by the New York University Archives in 2019.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Repository has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created between 1901 and 1912, are expected to enter the public domain between 2021 and 2032. Materials in this collection, which were created between 1894 and 1900, are in the public domain. Permission to publish or reproduce is not required.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials found in collection; there is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; New York University Archives Collection of Student Theses; MC.83; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The New York University Archives Collection of Student Theses consists of five theses written by New York University students in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Due to the age of the materials, they may not be suitable for duplication.
